results.title: Civil rights movement: Mississippi Summer Project
results.brief_description: Depicts the Civil Rights movement and the Summer Project of 1963 in a single community in Mississippi and highlights vital issues, such as the freedom schools set up by volunteers, labour exploitation, police brutality, voter registration and the challenge of achieving racial peace. Edited from the Richard Beymer presentation - “A Regular bouquet”.

results.title: The City: time of decision
results.creator_credit: Tibor Hirsch and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: Surveys the spiraling problems faced by overcrowded cities in the US and some of the measures taken to solve them. Looks at the evolution of major cities, then examines such present ills as slums, traffic congestion, pollution and over-crowding. Among the solutions pictured are urban renewal projects, rehabilitation, electric transport, traffic regulatory techniques, pollution control devices and the so-called “new towns” such as Reston in Virginia. Narrated by Jim Jensen.

results.title: Cityscape: impressions of a city
results.creator_credit: Ryan Larkin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An experiment, from NFB’s animation workshop, in creating continuous metamorphoses on the screen, employing charcoal drawings on a white board in a process of erasing, adding, photographing. In this film there is the impression of a succession of creatures moving across the screen, then disappearing into a hole. Eventually the hole changes to a bridge on which stands the youth who began the parade. Animation by Ryan Larkin. (Award: San Francisco)

results.title: City under pressure
results.creator_credit: Theodore Conant, Frank Spiller and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A case study of municipal government and the influence of citizens acting as a group. The study is of Edmonton, Canada, but the problems shown are common to many cities - urban renewal, traffic congestion, zoning etc. Listens in on discussion of these questions in Edmonton to provide ground for further discussion by the audience.

results.title: A City speaks
results.creator_credit: Paul Rotha, Films of Fact and Manchester City Corporation
results.brief_description: While dealing specifically with Manchester, England, this film is also intended to give a general picture of local government in England. A summary of Manchester’s growth through the centuries is given, stressing the rapid growth during the industrial revolution. Manchester’s past achievements and future plans are shown in some detail. Sequences showing Manchester at play are cut to the music of Wagner’s “Ride of the Valkyries”. The concluding sequences show citizens going about their work, while the commentary stresses that the city is its people.

results.title: The City Speaks
results.creator_credit: Crawford Productions and Housing Commission of Victoria
results.brief_description: Made in 1965 showing the provision of housing for Melbourne’s growing population, 50,000 of whom live in 1,000 acres of inner suburban slums. Following demolition, large block of flats provide the amenities and home comforts for low income families at low rentals where children can play happily in well planned playgrounds. The historic footage of the demolition of inner city dwellings to accommodate high rise housing commission flats and the intentions behind the move are interesting to view in retrospect.

results.title: City scene
results.creator_credit: George Kaczender, Gordon Burwash, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: No matter where you go in the world, it is in the city square that you see the character and culture of a people. Filmed in Montreal, Athens, and Bangkok, this film makes interesting comparisons of life at the core of three great cities. Photography by Paul Leach.

results.title: A City reborn
results.creator_credit: Peter Reinshagen and Victor Gruen Associates
results.brief_description: Illustrates good city planning, showing how Fresno, California, has revitalised its city centre by a plan implemented from 1964, diverting traffic from the city core, turning the main street into a long pedestrian mall. Contrasts the success of the plan with the inner city congestion and suburban disorganisation of many cities.

results.title: City port
results.creator_credit: Roger Dunton, David Powell and Abacus Documentaries
results.brief_description: Shows how the City of London, Lloyd’s, the Bank of England and other commercial institutions support the Port of London, and how the Port supplies goods to the city.

results.title: City of gold
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Wolf Koenig, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A nostalgic recollection of the period when the Yukon gold fever was at its height. The commentary, written and spoken by Dawson-born Pierre Berton, begins with childhood recollections of the writer. This feeling of retrospect is further deepened by the introduction of many vintage photographs which give the film a documentary quality as it reviews the history of the gold rush. We see relics of the old Dawson as it was when all the gold of the rich river beds flowed through its stores, taverns and dance halls.
